c74object.name: the.jit.amygdala~
c74object.digest: Poke signal data to a poly-dimensional matrix for offline rendering.
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Capture signal data to a specified poly-dimensional jit.matrix for offline reading and rendering, controlled by the.jit.thalamus. Designed to replace a jit.poke~ with flexible dimcount (by default: max. 13) and variable target plane.
Its counterpart the.mc.jit.amygala is to be placed after any named matrix otherwise being populated by jit.poke~ to iterate through the recorded frames at render rate.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context for all children objects to sync to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. It is necessary to provide a context name for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

objarg.name: matrix-name
objarg.description: The name of the jit_matrix to access (default = 0). Identical to the matrix used before with jit.poke

objarg.name: dim_inputcount
objarg.description: The number of dimensions in the named matrix (maximum: 13)

objarg.name: plane-index
objarg.digest: Plane for cell value to be replaced by leftmost channel
objarg.description: The plane in a cell whose value is replaced by leftmost channel in the multi-channel signal (default = 0)

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description:
When enabled will output a temporary jit_matrix representing an abstract compression of the running multich-channel audio upon completion of a single dimension-scan.
When disabled, a bang in leftmost inlet triggers output of most recent jit_matrix
The default is 0 (disabled)

attribute.name: autoclear
attribute.digest: Clear the compressed matrix before recording
attribute.description:
Clear the compressed matrix before recording. Ensures that later video rendering will only add the recorded data.
autoclear is disabled (0) by default
Unlike the.mc.jit.amygdala—where autoclear purges the actual target matrix—the matrix being cleared in this case is the recording (compressed) matrix.

attribute.name: exportname
attribute.digest: Specify a unique name to write to.
attribute.description: Specify a unique name to export to after completion of the capturing process, managed by the.jit.thalamus. The resulting filetype is jxf (Jitter binary data file) and can be re-exported/imported using the export and import messages, respectively.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object and poke signal data without recording
1 = operate normally (default); poke and record
2 = poke but do not record any new data
3 = (idle)
4 = record but never poke directly to matrix
5 = mute all activity
Note that while recording is disabled, the automatic export upon recording completion (if an exportname is specified) is also disabled and previous files will not be overwritten.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output temporary data matrix from rightmost outlet

method.name: multichannelsignal
method.digest: Realtime audio to write to the matrix
method.description:
the.mc.jit.amygdala~ expects a multi-channel signal, comprised of channels pertaining to the object box arguments
channel 1: value to write
channel 2: dim[0]
…
channel n: dim[n]

method.name: plane
method.digest: Specify the plane in the target matrix
method.description: During recording, the plane in the target matrix can be changed with the plane $1 message

method.name: export
method.digest: Export as Jitter binary data file
method.description:
If an exportname has previously been specified, the jxf-file will be written to the dir as specified by the.jit.thalamus.
If an optional argument is provided (symbol), a jxf-file with this name will be written to disk.

method.name: import
method.description:
If an exportname has previously been specified, the jxf-file will be read from the dir as specified by the.jit.thalamus.
If an optional argument is provided (symbol), it will be attempted to read a jxf-file with this name from disk.
